title: Neonatal (disseminated) listeriosis
chapter: Certain conditions originating in the perinatal period
block: Infections specific to the perinatal period
category: Other congenital infectious and parasitic diseases
inclusion: conditions that have their origin in the perinatal period even though death or morbidity occurs later
infections acquired in utero or during birth
exclusion: congenital malformations, deformations and chromosomal abnormalities
injury, poisoning and certain other consequences of external causes
asymptomatic human immunodeficiency virus [HIV] infection status
laboratory evidence of human immunodeficiency virus [HIV]
maternal infectious disease as a cause of mortality or morbidity in fetus or newborn not itself manifesting the disease
necrotizing enterocolitis of fetus or newborn
